org.artoolkit.ar6.base.camera

Class CameraPreferencesActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • PreferenceActivity
      • org.artoolkit.ar6.base.camera.CameraPreferencesActivity

  • public class CameraPreferencesActivity
extends PreferenceActivity
    CameraPreferencesActivity provides a menu which allows the camera and its resolution to be selected interactively by the user.

    To use CameraPreferencesActivity in your own application, add the following to your AndroidManifest.xml:

    The activity draws on string values provided by ARBaseLib's strings.xml resource.

    Additionally, if your activity is not based on ARActivity, the following additional additions must be made:

    Once per install of Application and prior to using any of the camera preferences, e.g. in Application.onCreate(), or if not subclassing Application, in Activity.onCreate():

    import android.preference.PreferenceManager; PreferenceManager.setDefaultValues(this, org.artoolkit.ar6.base.R.xml.preferences, false);

    When opening the camera:

    import android.os.Build; import android.preference.PreferenceManager; Camera camera = null; if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= Build.VERSION_CODES.GINGERBREAD) { int cameraIndex = Integer.parseInt(PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences (callingContext).getString("pref_cameraIndex", "0")); Camera.open(cameraIndex); } else { else camera = Camera.open(); }

    When configuring camera:

    String camResolution = PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(callingContext ).getString("pref_cameraResolution", getResources().getString(R.string.pref_defaultValue_cameraResolution)); String[] dims = camResolution.split("x", 2); Camera.Parameters parameters = camera.getParameters(); parameters.setPreviewSize(Integer.parseInt(dims[0]), Integer.parseInt(dims[1])); camera.setParameters(parameters);

    To determine if the camera is rear-facing or front-facing:

    boolean frontFacing = false; if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= Build.VERSION_CODES.GINGERBREAD) { Camera.CameraInfo cameraInfo = new Camera.CameraInfo(); int cameraIndex = Integer.parseInt(PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences (callingContext).getString("pref_cameraIndex", "0")); Camera.getCameraInfo(cameraIndex, cameraInfo); if (cameraInfo.facing == Camera.CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_FRONT) frontFacing = true; }

      • findAspectRatio

        public CameraPreferencesActivity.ASPECT_RATIO findAspectRatio(int w,
                                                     int h)
        A convenience method which makes it easy to determine the approximate aspect ratio of an image with the given resolution (expressed in pixel width and height). Returns a symbolic constant for the aspect ratio, which makes it easy to determine whether two different resolutions have the same aspect ratio.
        Parameters:
        w - Width in pixels
        h - Height in pixels
        Returns:
        If a matching commonly-used aspect ratio can be found, returns symbolic constant for that aspect ratio.

      • findAspectRatioName

        public java.lang.String findAspectRatioName(int w,
                                   int h)
        A convenience method which makes it easy to determine the approximate aspect ratio of an image with the given resolution (expressed in pixel width and height).
        Parameters:
        w - Width in pixels
        h - Height in pixels
        Returns:
        If a matching commonly-used aspect ratio can be found, returns string name for that aspect ratio.
